page.title: 13Transport
page.content: Rainford is served by buses belonging to Mersyside passenger transport executive and the Ribble Bus Company,and by British Rail trains. The M.P.T.E. services are between St.Helens and Rainford with occasional services linking Rainford Junction and Crank to St.Helens.The Ribble buses go through Rainford as part of a service linking St.Helens to Ormskirk and Southport. The British Rail Station is situated at Rainford Junction.This line links Liverpool Central and Manchester Victoria via Wigan.Part of this line is electrified although the service uses diesel locomotives on the Rainford section.The service is mainly used by commuters going to and from work in Liverpool.
